title: International rankings of the United States

paragraphs.text: The following are links to international rankings of the United States.

paragraphs.title: Health
paragraphs.text:
As of 2015[update], the Maternal Mortality Ratio is 46th out of the countries ranked.  (See Maternal mortality in the United States.)

Among wealthy nations, a study on 2016 data found the United States ranked first for child deaths by automobile accident and firearm, with overall child mortality 57% higher in the U.S. than other high-income countries. Though traffic deaths were decreasing, they were 5 times the rate in England and Wales; firearms deaths were increasing from a rate 100 times that in England and Wales.[6]

As of 2017[update], the United States life expectancy is 79.8 years at birth, ranking 42nd among 224 nations.[7]
